tutorial.title: Linktree - Part 5
tutorial.descriptionContent: Get ready to build your very own Linktree-style page, where you can showcase all your socials and other links you care about in one spot.

executableContent.instructions:
Welcome to the last part of your project. Let's add an image to give your page a personal flair.

1. Above the `h1` element, add an `img` element and set the `src` attribute to a URL that points to an image of you.

If you don't have a URL right now, ask AI to add an `img` tag for you. You can update it later.

files.name: index.html
files.content:
Emmy

Aspiring Software Developer

Welcome to my page! I'm Emmy, an aspiring software developer. Follow my journey by checking out my social media profiles. Happy coding!

Instagram TikTok

files.name: style.css

executableContent.instructions:
Now that we have an image, we need to ensure it fits the page layout.

1. Set the `width` attribute of the `img` element to a reasonable value in pixels, like `"150"`.

files.name: style.css

executableContent.instructions:
Let's style the image. 

1. Create an `img` selector in the CSS file by adding `img { }`.
2. Within the selector, set a `border-radius` property. Start with `75px` and make changes until you like what you see.

files.name: style.css

executableContent.instructions:
Let's set a top margin to improve the overall layout and visual appearance of your page.

1. Add a `margin-top` inside the `img` selector, for example, `20px`.

files.name: style.css

executableContent.instructions:
As web developers, we need to fight for the attention of our users and visitors. A great way to do that is through animations! Although that's a more advanced topic you'll learn later, with AI we can already create a simple one.

1. Ask AI to make the image bounce.
2. Then, ask it to explain the changes.

files.name: style.css

executableContent.instructions:
That's it for this project! Your knowledge and creativity combined with AI are transforming you into a true developer.

1. Feel free to make more changes to your page. Continue to the next lesson whenever you're ready.
